However, excluding cobalt and lithium, no single country holds more than a third of the world reserves.

s is still close to 600 years at current levels of demand

There are alternatives to the strategic minerals currently used to support a low
turbines can be manufactured without permanent magnets to reduce the need for strategic minerals, but
ction costs are higher, and their efficiency is reduced
Alternatives to silicon, such as thin films, could be used to produce PVs. Thin
based PV, but they contain other potentially critical metals like tellurium,
Hydropower is technically mature, proved worldwide as a primary source of renewable electricity, and
may be used to balance electricity
supply by providing flexibility and storage. The LCOE of
hydropower is lower than the cheapest new fossil fuel
fired option. However, the future mitigation
potential of hydropower depends on minimizing environmental and social impacts during the planning
tages, reducing the risks of dam failures, and modernising the aging hydropower fleet to increase
Estimates of global gross theoretical available hydropower potential varies from 31
This potential is distributed over 11.8 million locations (
), but many of the locations cannot
be developed for (current) technical, economic, or political reasons. The estimated technical potential
), and its estimated economic potential is 8
was 4.2 PWh (15.3 EJ), providing about 16% of global electricity and 43% of global electricity from
. Asia holds the largest hydropower potential
